C++ - Abstract

  • Introduction
  • References

  1. Introduction

    The above line is called pure virtual function.

  2. Examples

    1. Public interface with private implementation

      #include <iostream>
using namespace std;

class F{
public: //protected but no private
    virtual void pureVirtual() = 0;

};

class D: public F{
private:
    void pureVirtual(){
        cout << "D" << endl;
    }
};
int main(){
   // F f;
   F * f = new D();
    f->pureVirtual();
    return 0;
}
